clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Tolerance Evaluation of a "Revitalizing" Face Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Tolerance Evaluation of a "Revitalizing" Face Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: Efficacy and Tolerance Evaluation of a"revitalizing" face treatment consisting of a day and a night cream

detailed_description.textblock: Aim of the study was to evaluate clinically and by non-invasive instrumental evaluations the activity of a "revitalizing" face treatment consisting of a day and a night cream, applied for an uninterrupted period of 3 months, by female volunteers, aged 35-60 years, with aging/photo aging of moderate grade.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of wrinkles grade, around the eyes (Crow's feet)
primary_outcome.description: Variation of wrinkles grade from baseline of the Glogau's reference photographic scale (visual score from 1-4) where: Type 1: early wrinkles Type 2: wrinkle in motion Type 3: wrinkles at rest Type 4: Only wrinkles

primary_outcome.measure: Change of wrinkles grade of nasolabial folds
primary_outcome.description: Variation of wrinkles grade from baseline of the Lemperle's reference photographic scale (visual score from 1-6) where: Grade 1: no wrinkles Grade 2: just perceptible wrinkles Grade 3: shallow wrinkles Grade 4: moderately deep wrinkles Grade 5: deep wrinkles, well-defined folds Grade 6: very deep wrinkles, redundant fold

primary_outcome.measure: Change of skin surface microrelief's regularity
primary_outcome.description: Variation of skin surface microrelief's regularity grade from baseline of cheek surface microrelief photographic scale where: Grade 1:very regular Grade 2: regular Grade 3: irregular Grade 4: very irregular.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of skin resistance to pinching clinical score
primary_outcome.description: The evaluation was performed at level of cheek (malar region) according to the following score: 0 = very important = important = moderate = weak = very weak

primary_outcome.measure: Change of skin resistance to traction clinical score
primary_outcome.description: The evaluation was performed at level of cheek (malar region) according to the following score: 0 = very important = important = moderate = weak = very weak

primary_outcome.measure: Change of skin recovery after pinching clinical score
primary_outcome.description: The evaluation was performed at level of cheek (malar region) according to the following score: 0 = very important = important = moderate = weak = very weak

primary_outcome.measure: Change of skin dryness clinical score
primary_outcome.description: Clinical evaluation of skin dryness was performed according to the following score: 0 = very hydrated skin = hydrated skin = normal skin = kindly dry skin = dry skin = very dry skin

primary_outcome.measure: Change of vascular and pigmentary homogeneity clinical score
primary_outcome.description: Homogeneity grade was determined according to specific reference clinical and photographic scales and to the following clinical score: 0 = very homogeneous = homogeneous = quite not homogeneous = not homogeneous = very not homogeneous = marked not homogeneous

secondary_outcome.description: Crow's feet profilometric parameters measured by Primos compact portable device (GFMesstechnik). Ra is average roughness of the analysed profile, Rt is wrinkles total high, Rv is wrinkles maximum depth.
Three-dimensional pictures of the face taken by VECTRA H1 handheld imaging system.

clinical_study.condition: Face Aging/Photo Aging of Moderate Grade

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nutriage SPF 30 day cream and Nutriage night cream
arm_group.description: Application of the study products (day cream at the morning and night cream at the evening), for an uninterrupted period of 3 months.

intervention.intervention_name: Nutriage SPF 30 day cream and Nutriage night cream (Difa Cooper S.p.a, Italy)
intervention.description: A fixed quantity of both cosmetic products was applied for an uninterrupted period of 3 months, on the face included the submental area (day cream at the morning and the night cream at the evening), preferentially always at the same hour, with a mild massage
intervention.arm_group_label: Nutriage SPF 30 day cream and Nutriage night cream

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female sex,
- age 35-60 years,
- Caucasian subjects,
- presence of moderate face ritidosis,
- agreeing to present at each study visit without make-up,
- accepting to follow the instructions received by the investigator,
- accepting to not change their habits regarding food, physical activity, face cleansing and make- up use,
- agreeing not to apply or take any product or use face massages or other means known to improve skin wrinkle and skin qualities during the entire duration of the study,
- accepting not to expose their face to strong UV irradiation (UV session, or sun bathes), during the entire duration of the study,
- no participation in a similar study currently or during the previous 3 months
- accepting to sign the Informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy,
- lactation,
- sensitivity to the test products or their ingredients (to be assessed by the investigator during the baseline visit),
- subjects whose insufficient adhesion to the study protocol is foreseeable.
- presence of cutaneous disease on the tested area as lesions, scars, malformations,
- recurrent facial/labial herpes,
- clinical and significant skin condition on the test area (e.g. active eczema, dermatitis, psoriasis etc.).
- endocrine disease,
- hepatic disorder,
- renal disorder,
- cardiac disorder,
- pulmonary disease,
- cancer,
- neurological or psychological disease,
- inflammatory/immunosuppressive disease,
- drug allergy.
- anti-inflammatory drugs, anti-histaminic, topic (application on the face) and systemic corticosteroids, narcotic, antidepressant, immunosuppressive drugs (with the except of hormonal treatment starting more than 1 year ago),
- using of drugs or dietary supplements able to influence the test results in the investigator opinion.
